Title: Tayside Bowel Screening Dataset
Description: NHS Tayside health board bowel screening program.

Title: Outpatient Appointments and Attendances - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR00)
Description: The Outpatients (SMR00) dataset collects episode level data from patients on new and follow up appointments at outpatient clinics in all specialities (except A&E and Genito-Urinary Medicine).

Title: Outpatient Appointments and Attendances - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR00)
Description: The Outpatients (SMR00) dataset collects episode level data from patients on new and follow up appointments at outpatient clinics in all specialities (except A&E and Genito-Urinary Medicine).

Title: Scotland Accident and Emergency
OriginalTags: A and E;CO-CONNECT;COVID-19;NCS;NHS Scotland;National Core Study
Description: There are two types of data submitted to the A&E DataMart: episode and aggregate level data. All hospitals with Emergency Departments submit episode level data containing a detailed record for each patient attendance.

Title: Scotland Accident and Emergency
OriginalTags: A and E;CO-CONNECT;COVID-19;NCS;NHS Scotland;National Core Study
Description: There are two types of data submitted to the A&E DataMart: episode and aggregate level data. All hospitals with Emergency Departments submit episode level data containing a detailed record for each patient attendance.

Title: Fife Microbiology Lab
Description: NHS Fife Microbiology laboratory samples and tests data.

Title: NHS Tayside and Fife Biochemistry
Description: NHS Tayside and NHS Fife laboratory data.

Title: NHS Tayside A&E, Diagnosis During A&E visit
Description: Accident and Emergency episode level data.

Title: Scottish Medical Imaging (SMI) Research Dataset
Description: Contains pseudo-anonymised and linkable clinical imaging data from the National Picture Archiving and Communication System (NPACS).

Title: RAPID (Hospital Stay Level Data)
Description: The Rapid Preliminary Inpatient Data (RAPID) dataset contains the underlying admissions data which is used by System Watch. It enables access to the hospital admissions data  submitted in its unprocessed state e.g. it does not contain predictions.

Title: 2001 Census
Description: 2001 Census

Title: Prescribing Information System (PIS)
Description: The Prescribing Information System (PIS) is the definitive data source for all prescribing relating to all medicines and their costs that are prescribed and dispensed in the community in Scotland.

Title: Prescribing Information System (PIS)
Description: The Prescribing Information System (PIS) is the definitive data source for all prescribing relating to all medicines and their costs that are prescribed and dispensed in the community in Scotland.

Title: SHARE
Description: SHARE datasets for use solely for SHARE approved projects

Title: Walker Study Data
Description: Cohort of over 48,000 birth records (pregnancy, labour, birth and care) in Dundee. Between 1952-1966.  Contains information on the birthing events such as birth weight, date, feeding, and socio economic variables such as parent occupation.

Title: Mental Health Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR04)
FileName: Mental Health Inpatient and Day Case (SMR04) - variables
OriginalTags: CO-CONNECT;COVID-19;Daycases;Mental Health;NCS;NHS Scotland;National Core Study;Psychiatric Inpatients
Description: The Mental Health Inpatient and Day Case dataset (SMR04) collects episode level data on patients who are receiving care at psychiatric hospitals at the point of both admission and discharge.

Title: Mental Health Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR04)
OriginalTags: CO-CONNECT;COVID-19;Daycases;Mental Health;NCS;NHS Scotland;National Core Study;Psychiatric Inpatients
Description: The Mental Health Inpatient and Day Case dataset (SMR04) collects episode level data on patients who are receiving care at psychiatric hospitals at the point of both admission and discharge.

Title: Renal Register – PHS National Dataset
Description: Extract from Public Health Scotland Renal register for Tayside and Fife.

Title: Attendance and Absence linkage data - Scotland
Description: Attendance, authorised and unauthorised absence and temporary exclusions of children attending publicly funded local authority schools and one grant-aided mainstream school in Scotland.

Title: CRIS
Description: This dataset is provided to HIC as extracts from a system called CRIS, a popular Radiology Information System (RIS).

Title: NHS Tayside and Fife Immunology
Description: NHS Tayside and NHS Fife laboratory data.

Title: National Records of Scotland (NRS) - Births Data
FileName: National Records of Scotland (NRS) - Births Data - variables
Description: All Registrations to the National Records of Scotland of live births

Title: Tayside Pathology
Description: Tayside Pathology containing details from pathological samples and biopsy including diagnosis codes. This data originates from Ninewells Pathmanager.

Title: Tayside & Fife Diabetes – Summary and a range of diabetes related datasets.
Description: This data set provides an overview of the type of diabetes, the date it was diagnosed, the treatment type and healthboard the patient belongs to.

Title: The Aberdeen Children of the 1950's (ACONF)
Description: The Aberdeen Children of the 1950s (ACONF) holds health data for Aberdeen Birth Cohorts of people born in Aberdeen in 1921, 1936, and 1950-1956. It helps to understand the changes as we age and how to better our life quality as we get older.

Title: Covid-19 Tests
Description: Covid 19 Test Results

Title: Deaths – National Records Scotland
Description: Cause of death data from National Records Scotland (NRS, formerly General Registrar Office (GRO) and contains data relating to the causes of death of patients.

Title: MATCH
Description: 2000 health care workers in NHS Tayside and from social care will have blood samples tested to detect antibodies to SARS-CoV-2, to identify undiagnosed asymptomatic healthcare worker infections with COVID-19.

Title: Child Health Systems Programme - 4-5 year review
Description: The 4-5 year review form  is completed at around 4-5 years of age and is carried out by a health visitor.

Title: SIMD
Description: Health Informatic Centre Derived dataset covering Health Board and SIMD

Title: Aberdeen Maternity and Neonatal Databank (AMND)
Description: The Aberdeen Maternity and Neonatal Databank holds data for all Aberdeen City births from 1949 to the present day. From 1951 to present this unique database links all the obstetric and fertility-related events occurring to women from a defined population.

Title: Lighthouse
Description: Lighthouse laboratories [high-throughput facilities dedicated to COVID-19]

Title: SAS(Scottish Ambulance Service) Hypoglycemic
Description: This data set contains Hypoglycemic Events and is provided for the whole of Scotland.

Title: Pupil Census linkage data - Scotland
OriginalTags: ADR;Administrative Data Research;administrative;annual census;children;education;publicly funded schools
Description: Children attending publicly funded local authority and grant-aided schools in Scotland.

Title: Prescribing
Description: Community-dispensed primary care prescription data.

Title: SICSAG Episodes (Scottish Intensive Care Audit Group)
Description: The Scottish Intensive Care Society Audit Group (SICSAG) has maintained a national database of patients admitted to adult general Intensive Care Units (ICU) in Scotland since 1995. Each line relates to an ‘episode of care’ in critical care.

Title: GP Out of Hours
Description: NHS Boards provide Primary Care OOH services for patients when their registered GP Practice is closed.

Title: NHS Tayside and Fife Accident & Emergency Dataset (PHS/National)
Description: Accident and Emergency Statistics. There are two types: episode and aggregate level data.

Title: SICSAG Daily (Scottish Intensive Care Audit Group)
Description: The Scottish Intensive Care Society Audit Group (SICSAG) has maintained a national database of patients admitted to adult general Intensive Care Units (ICU) in Scotland since 1995. Each line relates to a day of stay in critical care.

Title: Scottish Birth Record (SBR)
Description: The Scottish Birth Record (SBR) records baby's neonatal care in Scotland,  including readmissions and transfers in one electronic record. SBR is completed for all births in Scotland including stillbirths and home births.

Title: Tayside Microbiology Lab
Description: NHS Tayside Microbiology laboratory samples and tests data.

Title: NHS Tayside Virology
Description: Scottish laboratory data covering virology tests from the Tayside regions.

Title: General Acute Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR01)
FileName: General Acute Inpatient and Day Case (SMR01) - variables
Description: The General / Acute and Inpatient Day Case dataset (SMR01) collects episode level data on hospital inpatient and day case discharges from acute specialities from hospitals in Scotland.

Title: General Acute Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR01)
Description: The General / Acute and Inpatient Day Case dataset (SMR01) collects episode level data on hospital inpatient and day case discharges from acute specialities from hospitals in Scotland.

Title: 2011 Census - COVID19 Research Database Subset
Description: A subset of 2011 Census variables (and variable breakdowns) in the COVID-19 Research Database

Title: Unscheduled Care Data Mart
OriginalTags: A and E;Ambulance;CO-CONNECT;COVID-19;NCS;NHS Scotland;National Core Study;Out of Hours;Unscheduled Care
Description: The data mart links data from (NHS 24, Scottish Ambulance Service, Out of Hours Primary Care, Emergency Department, Acute, Mental Health and Deaths) to show a Continuous Unscheduled Care Pathway (CUP) for records with a valid CHI number.

Title: NHS Tayside - A&E drugs given during an A&E visit
Description: Accident and Emergency episode level data.

Title: Scottish Cancer Registry (SMR06)
Description: Public Health Scotland is responsible for the collection of information on Scottish residents when they are diagnosed with malignant (and some benign) tumours.

Title: Scottish Cancer Registry (SMR06)
Description: Public Health Scotland is responsible for the collection of information on Scottish residents when they are diagnosed with malignant (and some benign) tumours.

Title: Tayside & Fife Radiology
Description: Extracts from local health board Radiology Information System (RIS). - covers all patients in the health boards who attend hospital for radiology exams, and includes booking system information, imaging modality, body part and text based radiology report.

Title: Unscheduled Care
Description: This data originates from the Ad Astra system.

Title: ECHO
Description: Tayside echocardiographic dataset. The dataset collects all the values obtained during the scan

Title: Demography
Description: Patient demographic data from the national CHI dataset.

Title: Scottish Covid-19 Vaccination Data
Description: This dataset contains COVID-19 Vaccination events in Scotland since December 2020. This includes information such as eligibility cohort, date of vaccination, and vaccination product.

Title: NHS Tayside and Fife Haematology
Description: NHS Tayside and Fife labs Haematology data.

Title: Covid 19 Accident and Emergency Statistics
Description: Contains data on episode level new and unscheduled attendances at Emergency Departments and some smaller community hospitals and minor injury units (MIUs).

Title: Child protection linkage data - Scotland
OriginalTags: ADR;Administrative Data Research;Social work;administrative;child protection case conference;child protection investigation
Description: Children involved in a child protection investigation or case conference by a Scottish Local Authority.

Title: Child Health Systems Programme - 27-30Months Review
Description: The 27-30 month review form is completed at around 27-30 months of age and is carried out by a health visitor. This review started in April 2013 and is offered to all children (previously only children requiring structured additional/intensive support).

Title: Maternity Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR02)
FileName: Maternity Inpatient and Day Case (SMR02) - variables
Description: The Maternity Inpatient and Day Case dataset (SMR02) collects episode level data every time a mother goes in for an obstetric event (this can be an antenatal, delivery or postnatal episode).

Title: Maternity Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR02)
Description: The Maternity Inpatient and Day Case dataset (SMR02) collects episode level data every time a mother goes in for an obstetric event (this can be an antenatal, delivery or postnatal episode).

Title: National Records of Scotland (NRS) - Stillbirth Data
Description: All Registrations to the National Records of Scotland of stillbirths.

Title: Child Health Systems Programme - First Visit
Description: The Health Visitor First Visit form is generally completed at around 10 days after the birth of the child. This begins the child's electronic surveillance record and gathers basic identification, family and social data.

Title: SCI Diabetes
Description: SCI-Diabetes provides a fully integrated shared electronic patient record to support treatment of NHSScotland patients with Diabetes

Title: Exclusions linkage data - Scotland
OriginalTags: ADR;Administrative Data Research;Children and young people;administrative;children;exclusions;publicly funded schools
Description: The exclusions collection covers all publicly funded local authority schools in Scotland

Title: Follow-COVID
Description: Follow-COVID is a study of over 100 patients across multiple regions within Scotland over the course of 6 years.   The study seeks to identify the long term consequences and future care needs of COVID-19 survivors.

Title: Scottish Stillbirth and Infant Death Survey
Description: The Scottish Stillbirth and Infant Death Survey (SSBIDS) collects additional information on stillbirths, neonatal deaths and late fetal deaths.

Title: National Records of Scotland (NRS) - Deaths Data
FileName: National Records of Scotland (NRS) - Deaths Data - variables
Description: All registrations to the National Records of Scotland of deaths

Title: National Records of Scotland (NRS) - Deaths Data
Description: All registrations to the National Records of Scotland of deaths

Title: Child Health Systems Programme - 13-15 Month Review
Description: The 13-15 month review form is completed at around 13-15 months of age and is carried out by a health visitor. This review started in April 2017 and is offered to all children (although implementation of the review across Scotland may vary)

Title: Equalities Protected Characteristics Dataset
Description: The dataset combines population census, hospital admissions and school education data from Scottish Government (i.e. Pupil Census) to provide a reference dataset with as near to whole population level coverage as possible, and with as up-to-date information as possible, of many of the protected characteristics defined under the Equality Act across Scotland.

Title: Child Health Systems Programme - 6-8week review
Description: The 6-8 week review form is generally completed at around 6-8 weeks after the birth of the child and is often a health visitor and GP combined review.

Title: Deaths – Date of Death
Description: This dataset provides the definitive date of death for patients in Scotland.

Title: Looked after children linkage data - Scotland
OriginalTags: ADR;Administrative;Administrative Data Research;Children and young people;Social work;looked after children
Description: A longitudinal dataset based on annual returns of administrative data on looked after children data supplied by local authorities to Scottish Government for statistical purposes. Looked after children are those children in the care of a local authority.

Title: National Qualifications linkage data - Scotland
OriginalTags: ADR;Administrative Data Research;Scottish Qualifications Authority;administrative;children;education;publicly funded schools;qualifications
Description: Children presenting for SQA National Qualification examinations from all stages of publicly funded local authority secondary schools and one grant-aided mainstream school in Scotland.

Title: School leaver destinations and attainment linkage data - Scotland
OriginalTags: ADR;Children and young people;Education;administrative;attainment;children;destination;publicly funded schools;qualifications;school leavers
Description: School leavers from all stages of publicly funded local authority secondary schools and one grant-aided mainstream school in Scotland.
